question: Which of the following reagents are suitable to differentiate Aniline and N-methylaniline chemically?
choices: Conc. Hydrochloric acid and anhydrous zinc chloride
explanation: Chloroform and Alcoholic KOH (Carbylamine test) gives a foul smell with primary amines (Aniline) but does not react with secondary amines (N-methylaniline) [cite: 964-971].
